iati-activity.title: Tearfund Scotland:Empowerment of girls and boys through increased access to education: A long term response to HIV and AIDS in Karonga district - Iponga, and Ighembe Education Zones
iati-activity.description: The aim is to enable engagement in formal education particularly for girls and vulnerable groups in Karonga, an area where harmful cultural practices are widespread and have been documented to reduce enrolment and retention of pupils in school. It builds on a pilot working with girls in the Iponga area funded by the Scottish Government from 2008-09. This project will support girls and boys with formal education, HIV/ AIDS life skills and raise community awareness. Activities will include working with local chiefs, churches, government extension workers and established structures to identify children and extend the HIV/AIDS based life skills groups already in place. Tearfund plan to work with 500 vulnerable boys and girls in Karonga to enable them to access and continue with their education. They also anticipate that they will have increased HIV/ AIDS knowledge in over 16,000 boys and girls to help them to make safe choices on sexual activities.
